newsitem.title: GERMANY: Exxon, Shell units form Polish oil/gas venture.
newsitem.headline: Exxon, Shell units form Polish oil/gas venture.

text.p: Exxon Corp and Shell said on Wednesday they had agreed to found a joint company called the Polish Petroleum Development Company Sp.z.o.o. to explore for oil and gas in Poland.
Exxon's Esso AG German unit and Shell Exploration Orient B.V. will form the company as soon as approval is received from the Polish authorities, according to an Esso statement.
The company would then negotiate with Poland's environment ministry to agree terms for exploration and the awarding of concessions.
"Esso AG is optimistic that this step will, with the help of the authorities, lead to the start of exploration," Esso AG chief executive Jobst Siemer said.
Esso already runs high-volume petrol stations in western Poland, and the construction of more is planned.
